holidays.name: Sneak Some Zucchini Onto Your Neighbor's Porch Day
holidays.description: A playful tradition encouraging gardeners to share their bountiful zucchini harvest by mysteriously leaving zucchinis on their neighbors' doorsteps without being seen!
holidays.origin: This quirky holiday was started in the early 2000s among gardening communities as a humorous way to cope with the overabundance of zucchini plants during peak season.
holidays.funFact: Zucchini plants can produce up to 10 pounds of fruit in a week—hence the need to sneak extras onto neighbors' porches!

holidays.name: International Cat Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate our purring pals, raise awareness about feline welfare, and indulge in some serious cat cuddling and pampering.
holidays.origin: Created in 2002 by the International Fund for Animal Welfare to highlight the needs and benefits of cats worldwide.
holidays.funFact: August 8 was chosen because it’s the lucky number 8 in many cultures, symbolizing prosperity and good fortune—just like our beloved cats!

holidays.name: Middle Child’s Day
holidays.description: A special day dedicated to the often-overlooked middle children, recognizing their unique role and the quirks of being the middle sibling.
holidays.origin: Started unofficially in the 1960s, this day aims to celebrate middle children who sometimes feel stuck between the oldest and youngest siblings.
holidays.funFact: Middle children are statistically more likely to be peacemakers and negotiators in families!

holidays.name: Happiness Happens Day
holidays.description: A day encouraging everyone to focus on and share happiness in their lives, spreading positivity and smiles wherever they go.
holidays.origin: Founded in 1999 by Dennis Prager to inspire people to recognize and appreciate moments of happiness daily.
holidays.funFact: Studies show sharing happiness with others can boost your own happiness levels—so this day makes science work in our favor!
